main event: A bright light object, approximately the size of a dime held at arm's length, was observed maneuvering over a home in Bakersfield, California on April 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about 3 times north 1/2 mile in altitude and hovered in one spot for some time before moving off in a straight line, disappearing in seconds.
This was the second time the witness, Mrs. Edith J. Coy, had observed such an object in the vicinity in the last 6 months.

On April 27, 1955, another witness observed a stationary object in the sky, approximately the size of a lime held at arm's length, with a pulsating reddish-white glow and emitting beams of light from its celestial body.
The object on April 27 was observed for a considerable length of time and made no sound.
At the time of the April 6 sighting, the planet Jupiter was high in the southwestern sky, and the report suggests the sighting may have been of Jupiter.
sighted object: a bright light object, approximately the size of a dime held at arm's length, and a stationary object approximately the size of a lime held at arm's length with a pulsating reddish-white glow and emitting beams of light
witnesses: Mrs. Edith J. Coy, civilian witness
